(1) to ride; to mount (a horse). (2) to be placed on sth.
to become soft
to shiver, to shuddle, to tremble; to be startled | bərɟadələ m-k̭arta He is shivering from cold
to dance
to become crinkled (skin, paper after being wet) | ɟəlda ruk̭rək̭lə The skin became crinkled
to tremble, to shiver | cf. raɟəd I to shiver
to become distant; to keep far, to move away, to abstain, to avoid, to shun | bərxak̭əna m-+uydalə They are distant from one another
to be kind; to have mercy | rxum +ʾalli Be kind to me; ʾaláha ràxəm +ʾalmàlla| May God have mercy on the mullah (A 4:11)
to crawl, to creep | +mazuzta ci-raxša A lizard crawls
(Pers. razīl < Arab. worthless, ignoble) to despise, to ridicule
to boil (intr.), to begin to boil | bašlívalə ɟu-míyya +bərdàxa| They cooked it in boiling water (B 17:9)
to darn
(Arab. rajama) to stone
to crawl, to creep (insect)

def: to flap the wings | cteta +raprupela ɟulpano The chicken is flapping its wings
longdef: to flap the wings | cteta +raprupela ɟulpano The chicken is flapping its wings

def: to make a sign of the cross (on so
longdef: (1) to make a sign of the cross (on so. or on oneself) | +sliva +ršəmlə He made the sign of the cross. (2) to mark, to sign a letter | ʾaha məndi +ršumlə Mark this; +ɟora ʾu-baxta +ršiməna The man and woman are marked (to be married, before being engaged); ʾánnə +ṱlibàlun,| ʾáx +bəršàmona| They have requested her hand in marriage, as if marking her (B 10:22)
to become broad
to run, to rush (on foot)

to be drawn to so., to sympathize; to desire, to covet, to yearn for | dəmmu +ruxrəxlə He heaved with emotion (he felt a close bond with so.); dəmmi +ruxrəxvalə +ʾallu My heart went out to him; I felt close to him
to calm down, to become quiet; to be relieved (of pain)
to bear witness; to testify; to certify, to confirm; to protest
(1) to become weary, to become annoyed; to become bored. (2) to shrink back from. (3) to grow decrepit
to become beautiful, to be well-groomed, to beautify oneself | cma sk̭əllax! How fine you look!

to dress up (tr. and intr.), to beautify, to decorate, to adorn | suk̭lala ɟano She dressed up; cút-yum cút-yum sak̭làva,| bak̭làva| c-oyáva bərrə́šša ndáya ndàya| Every day she used to dress herself beautifully and used to go leaping, leaping (A 52:1)
to criticize so. behind their back | bəsk̭amolə k̭a-švavu He is criticizing her to his neighbour
(Pers. saqat < Arab.) (1) to cripple, to maim; to be crippled, maimed. (2) to mutilate, to be mutilated
to plunder, to steal, to rob

(1) to become red; to blush | vardə bət-samk̭i The flowers will become red; duna smik̭ə They have become red; baxti smək̭la My wife blushed; ɟắri jə́ns ʾó tanúyra samə̀k̭ni| The oven must come nice and red. (2) to become brown (bread in oven) | laxma smək̭lə ɟu-tanuyra The bread became brown in the oven. (3) to roast (intr. meat)
(1) to lean, to lean against, to be propped up. (2) to rest, refresh, to refresh oneself. (3) to bear, to support, to prop up. (4) to assist, to protect
to need (+ʾal- sth.), to be in want, to require | bət-sank̭ən +ʾallux I will need you
to empty (intr.); to empty out, to spill | miyya spək̭lun The water spilt

(1) to empty (tr.) | +bayyə sapək̭lə vadra He wants to empty the bucket; míyya sapùk̭olə| He empties it (the waterskin) of water (A 37:15). (2) to spill (tr.) | miyya supk̭eli I spilt the water. (3) to unload, to discharge (a gun)
to wait, to wait for; to hope, to expect | bət-sap̂rən +ʾallux I shall wait for you; bət-sap̂rən k̭at ʾa-+šula ʾodətlə I expect you to do this
to decay, to rot, to decompose

(1) to sieve; to sift (wheat) | bət-sarəd +xəṱṱə he will sieve wheat; sarada bəsradelə +xəṱṱə The sieve sieves the wheat. (2) to pull down, to knock down, to pull apart | bəsradələ +ṱarpə mən-+ʾal-+pava He is pulling down leaves from the branch; lè sardívalun ʾátxa xína mən-+ʾúydalə| They would not pull them (the grapes) apart (B 10:1)

def: to saddle | dulə surrəjju suysu He has saddled his horse
longdef: to saddle | dulə surrəjju suysu He has saddled his horse
to comb

def: to suck in (liquid) | miyya bəsrapelə b-ney He is sucking up the water with a straw
longdef: (1) to suck in (liquid) | miyya bəsrapelə b-ney He is sucking up the water with a straw; srəplə +zāt He sucked in soup. (2) to soak up (a liquid). (3) to imbibe. (4) to inhale | k̭a-+hava srup! Breath in the air
to deny, to reject, to disown, to renounce, to refuse | bət-sarvənnux I shall reject you, disown you; nášət ɟánu bəsravèlə| He disowns his own family (A 48:6)

(1) to quake, to shake; to tremble, to cause to tremble | sarɟudəvən +xəṱṱə ɟu-ʾərbala I am shaking wheat in the sieve; surɟədli mən-k̭arta I trembled from the cold; k̭arta k̭am-sarɟəddali The cold made me tremble. (2) to make a calendar
to saddle

(Pers. sarsɑ̄m ‘delirium’) (1) to bother, to irritate, to disturb, to annoy | k̭ala sarsumilə the sound is annoying me; k̭am-sarsəmmətli you have irritated me. (2) to cause a headache, to have a headache. (3) to cause one’s ears to ring
to hiss; to whistle (sound of whistle), to yell, to howl, to yell (in high tone), to growl, to roar
(< surṱa fs. of sura) to become small

to rip; to unstitch, to unwind, to become unstitched (intr.); to untwine, to pull down, to pull up (roots), to take to pieces, to break up, to destroy | ʾa-+parča bəsṱarulə He is unstitching this cloth; dula ɟdalə bəsṱaré She is undoing the threads; +parča +ṱyapulə k̭at la saṱər He is hemming the cloth so that it does not become unstitched; miz bəsṱarulə He is taking the table apart; +ʾo-k̭uti duna bəsṱaru tica tica They are taking the box apart piece by piece; calba dulə bəsṱarolə +ʾarra The dog is digging up the ground; la sṱur muxi! Don’t freak me out
(Arab. istaxbara) (1) to visit (the sick, a friend). (2) to go out to ask after the health of | bərrəxšən saxbərrun I am going to visit them
to grow old, to turn grey

(Pers. sɑ̄zgɑ̄r) to become reconciled; to agree (e.g. on a price), to settle; to befriend | čirəva, suzɟərrun They were alienated and have become reconciled; ʾḗn +xnamíyyəda suzɟə̀rre +ʾúydalə| The in-laws made peace with each other (A 55:8)

to feel at home, to trust (b- so.); not to feel homesick, to have companionship; to talk, to chat | ʾana bət-+sabrən biyyux I shall feel at ease with you; bət-+sabər +tama He will have companionship there

(1) to crouch, to squat, to sit on one’s haunches. (2) metaphor. to become dysfunctional, to die | muxu +sk̭əṱlə He had a stroke; varidət ləbbi +sk̭iṱələ The artery of my heart has stopped working; muxu +sk̭əṱlə He had a stroke
to sober up; to get well; to recover; come to (after fainting)
(1) to stand upright, to sit upright (especially animal). (2) to hang the head (especially animal) | calba +sundəllələ +bayyə +mixulta The dog is sitting upright, it wants food
(1) to burn (food) (intr.); to turn rancid (food) | +busra +snənnə The meat burnt; ɟarmət ʾak̭li +sənnə The bone of my leg panged with pain. (2) to be saturated with smoke. (3) to sag
(1) to drip down, to trickle down | dəmma mən +sup̂p̂atu +sansulələ Blood is dripping from his fingers. (2) to pour down, to offer a libation

(1) to have darting pains; to smart; to cause to smart | darbi +sup̂p̂i +sansupolə My wound is making my finger smart; +sansəpva, k̭a-mu mana +šməṱlux May it smart, why have you broken the pot? (curse). (2) to become intensely cold | +sansupəla It is very cold; k̭arta +sansəppanta biting cold.
to plead, to beg, to implore; to desire greatly, to ask for alms
to be pungent, to smart (mouth) | +srəplə pummi My mouth is smarting
to draw line, to scratch; to write badly, to scribble
(1) to be mad (animals, especially with rabies); to become enraged, furious. (2) to be ignited (with passion)
to exchange money
to chirp (cricket); to roar (lion)

(1) to destroy, to be destroyed; to be ruined, to ruin; to fall in (e.g. well or a roof) | +sṱəmlə beti My house was ruined (everything in my life went wrong); ʾana bət-+saṱmənnə betux I shall make your life hell. (2) to stop up or fill up (e.g. well)
to stare, to gaze, to prick up (ears), | +ʾaynu +suṱləṱtelə He stared; +suṱləṱṱelun natyatu He pricked up his ears
to fear, to be terrified

def: to have darting pains | cici dulə +suxləxlə My tooth has darting pains
longdef: to have darting pains | cici dulə +suxləxlə My tooth has darting pains

def: to become clear (weather) | šmayya dula +suxvənta The sky has become clear
longdef: to become clear (weather) | šmayya dula +suxvənta The sky has become clear
(1) to hunt, to chase, to fish, to trap | bərrəxšəvən +sedən ʾelə I am going to hunt deer. (2) to look out, lie in wait for, to catch a person unawares
(1) to drain (intr.), to be filtered, to flow out, to leak, to dry up | miyya +səplun ɟu-+bəzzət luyla The water drained away in the hole of the pipe. (2) to expire. (3) to get well, to recover
to praise, to give thanks (+ʾal-/k̭a- to) →šcira

def: to sew with plain stitch → šucluca
longdef: to sew with plain stitch → šucluca

def: to shake | ʾilanət +šadə ci-šacšəccivalun They used to shake the almond trees
longdef: to shake | ʾilanət +šadə ci-šacšəccivalun They used to shake the almond trees. Cf. +napəs I (vn. +npasta) to shake by beating, to shake off

(1) to go mad, to madden | šuddə̀nnət?| Have you gone mad? (A 3:82); +raba ramələ k̭ala, bət-šaddənli The noise is very loud, it will drive me mad. (2) to become enraged. (3) to grow profusely (plants) | baxčət diyyan šuddənna Our garden has grown profusely
to make a fuss of, to flatter; to stroke | yala sura šadulula She is making a fuss of the baby; calba šadululə He is stroking the dog

(1) to take, to receive | šk̭ul Here it is! (lit. Take!). It generally takes a direct object complement, but occasionally is used with b-: b-šak̭líva b-dán canušyáy dàyk̭ə| They used to take hold of those fine brooms (B 10:18). (2) to take away, to deprive, to subtract. (3) to buy | xə́šlə šk̭ə́llə xá Rbuk̭étR ʾátxa vàrdə| He went and bought a bouquet of flowers like this (A 42:5). (4) plate (with metal) | cúllə šk̭ə́ltəla b-míyyət dàva| It is all plated with gold (A42:10).

to smart; to make smart; to burn (skin with hot water, poisonous leaves) | lišani šak̭luk̭ələ mən-+sərpət +buybar My tongue is smarting from the hotness of the pepper; bət-šak̭lək̭k̭ənnə +paġrux I’ll make your body hurt (I’ll beat you); +šulanə šuk̭lək̭k̭ə vədlux You have done some shocking things
to empty out
(1) to clatter (šak̭) (e.g. by shaking pebbles in a box), to rattle. (2) to knock, to ring. (3) to roar with laughter

to pull at; to pull off, to pull out, to uproot, to pluck, to pluck up, to pick | ʾana cosu šləɟli I pulled at his hair; šlə́ɟlə ṱúprət xmàri| He pulled off the tail of my donkey (A 7:13); bulə šləɟlə He pulled off the heads of corn. Cf. načəl I (vn. nčalta) to pull out with force (plant, tree from ground)
to boil (intr. and tr.); to scald, to be scalded | šlək̭li biyyə I boiled eggs; biyyə šlik̭ə boiled eggs
to scald, to dip in boiling water; to cook in boiling water | +biyyə šulk̭ə boiled eggs
(1) to consent (+ʾal to), to agree (+ʾal- to) | ʾana k̭bəlli ʾət-šalmən +ʾal-k̭anuné I agreed to adhere to their rules. (2) to be at peace. (3) to be made perfect

def: to become dislocated | +ruši šləpli My shoulder was dislocated
longdef: to become dislocated | +ruši šləpli My shoulder was dislocated
to dislocate (tr.)
to peel off (intr.), to lose skin, to slough off | ɟəldət +heyvan šləxlə He stripped off the skin of the animal

(1) to strip off (especially clothes, possessions), to undress | julli šulxeli I undressed. (2) to peel, to rip (skin). (3) to plunder, to rob | ɟinavə šuləxlun k̭ati The robbers stripped me (of my possessions)
(1) to be exhausted, to be shattered (by fatigue) | šulɟədli! I’m knackered! (2) dishevelled, scruffy | lvəštu šulɟəttəla His clothing is scruffy. Cf. šaləɟ I to pull off
to become quiet
to feel nauseous; to become faint
to become musty; to make musty | +mixulta šumxənna The food has become musty; miyya šumxənnalun +mixulta The water made the food musty
to swerve, to turn aside; to stray from duty
(1) to tame (wild animal). (2) to pacify, to placate. (3) to civilise. (4) to regain one’s temper; to be at peace, to be quiet
(1) to hang loose, to dangle; to be limp or languid, to droop. (2) to relax. (3) to become lazy; to waddle; to drawl

def: to flatten arable land with a → šapna | šapna +ʾarra šupnalə The šapna made the ground level
longdef: to flatten arable land with a → šapna | šapna +ʾarra šupnalə The šapna made the ground level; +ʾarra šupənta flattened land
to overflow, to burst forth, to flood (river); to overwhelm; to pour, pour out; | nara špəxlə The river overflowed. Cf. tapəx I (vn. tpaxta) to spill (intr.)
to beg, to implore; to desire greatly | šaplupəvən biyyux I implore you

(1) to drag, to be dragged. (2) to crawl, to glide, to shuffle the feet. (3) to grope, to rub | ʾidi šupšəppali ɟu-xəšca I grope with my hand in the dark; la šapšəp biyyi! do not grope me (sexually)! (4) to splash in water
to become lame, to become paralyzed
to flatter, to butter up, to make seem good when not | bəšp̂arələ biyyu He is buttering him up → mašp̂ər III

to make beautiful, to become beautiful; to get prettier, to smarten up (tr. and intr.) to decorate, to be decorated | +pəlláncas +ɟóro myàtələ| ʾína véla xə́šta ɟáno šup̂rə̀ntola| So-and-so’s husband is dying but she has gone and beautified herself (A 24:2)
(1) to take part, to share, to become a partner or companion. (2) to take the sacrament, to marry
(1) to suck (with energy, esp. a whole egg). (2) to eat all the inside (of a bird). (3) to peck out the eyes | Cf. +mayəs/+mās I to suck (milk), to sip
(i) to become jealous (of b-); to desire strongly (something tasty or beautiful) | bəšrazəvən biyyux I am jealous of you; ʾana šrəzli b-do naša I became jealous of that man
(ii) to crack, to fissure (with small cracks) | mana šrizələ The pot is cracked

def: to crack | bita šurk̭əptla The egg cracked
longdef: to crack | bita šurk̭əptla The egg cracked; +ʾarra šurk̭əpla +bar-+rodana The ground cracked after an earthquake
to crack, to break
to share, to participate | ʾana bət-šarrəccən mənnu ɟu-ctavtət do ctava I will collaborate with him in writing that book
to plant, to transplant (plants, so that they will be less dense); to plant out seedlings
QI to found, to establish

to spread out (on an object), to hang out (washing) | +ʾanvə bəšṱaxélə +ʾal-varazan k̭at-ʾavi cəšmišə He is spreading out the grapes on the slope so that they become raisins; šṱixeli jullə +ʾal-ɟdala k̭am-šəmša; I hung the clothes out on a string in the sun +supra bəšṱaxuna +ʾal-+ʾarra They are spreading the picnic cloth on the ground

(1) to leave. (2) to permit, to allow, to admit | šuk̭li! Let it be! le šok̭ən ʾazət I shall not allow you to go; švək̭lə dək̭nu, la +ɟrilə He let his beard grow, he did not shave. (3) to release, to pardon, to forgive, to excuse | švuk̭ Sorry! ɟu-de-báva míyya bəšvak̭ḗtva| In that basin you would release the water (B 17:31)
(1) to jump, to jump out, to jump over, to jump off, to jump upon, to pounce on, to spring up or forth. (2) to jig (in dance) | bət-+šori m+al-č̭appar They will jump over the fence
to become warm, to become hot | b-dó nuyra bəšxànəva| They would warm themselves by the fire (B 17:55)
to change (tr. and intr.); to modify, to distort | +bayyət +havux šaxləp? Do you want your air to change? Do you want a change

to become dirty; to make dirty; to pollute, to soil, to litter, to blight, to stir up (water) | +sudri šuxtənna b-k̭ava My shirt became dirty with the coffee; k̭ava +sudri šuxtənnalə The coffee has made my shirt dirty; šaxtantət ləbba nausea

(1) to rub | šyapa-šyapa sliding, crawling. (2) to rub off, to erase | +bayyə šayəplə šəmmu He wants to erase his name. (3) to rub into; to smear, to grease, to spread | švalta bəšyapola He is spreading the glue. (4) to stroke (an animal)

def: to become proud | štavhurəvən biyyux I am proud of you
longdef: to become proud | štavhurəvən biyyux I am proud of you
to send, to send away, to dispatch, to let go

(1) to break (tr. and intr.), to smash (tr. and intr.); to break off (tr. and intr.) | +šməṱlə bita He broke an egg. (2) to overthrow, to conquer; to be overthrown, to be conquered | šməṱlun mən-dəžmən They were defeated by the enemy. (3) to lower/go down in price
to burst out, to burst open; to crack open (e.g. glass from heat)

(1) to sag down, to hang loosely, to come down (e.g. trousers), to flow down (wheat from storage bin) | +pava +šrəṱlə mən-+ṱunta The branch sagged on account of the fruit; ɟarə šrəṱlə The roof fell in; +tumbanu +šrəṱlə His trousers fell down; +ṱarpə +yarixə +šriṱə long, hanging leaves. (2) to slip or drop out of place; to fall from the hand; to fall off. (3) to pull off, to put out the eyes. (4) to look down in token of refusal
to confirm, to prove

(1) to gush (water), to flow down with plashing sound (waterfall, fountain). (2) to pour (intr. and tr.) | miyya +šuršərrun +ʾalli The water poured onto me; ʾana miyya +šaršurəvən I am pouring water. →+šəršər plashing noise; →+šoršora waterfall
to sag; to hang down; to slide | +tumbanu +šaršuṱələ His trousers are sagging

def: to stretch out (on the floor to rest)
longdef: to stretch out (on the floor to rest); to stretch so. out (on the ground) | dulə +šṱixa +ʾal-+ʾarra He is stretched out on the ground; +šaṱxənnux! I’ll knock you to the ground!
to become black (with soot); to make black (with soot) | betət tanuyra +šuxrənnə The oven house has become black
to make neatly, to make tidy, to organize | xa naša tuk̭nək̭k̭a a neat man

to be lost, to vanish, to cease to exist, to disappear, to perish | cifi tlək̭lə My wallet has disappeared (= I have lost my wallet); tluk̭! Get out!; tlək̭la +ʾallé They were baffled; they were dazed

to lose; to waste; to destroy | tulk̭ali cifi I have lost my wallet; lēn +byaya +raba +dana talk̭ən I do not want to waste much time; xácma … məndiyyànə +bək̭yárələ| … k̭át +dánu talə̀k̭la| He carves some things … to pass the time (A 37:8)
to remove oneself, to go away; to be ruined or lost | tlup xuš! Get lost!; tlup mən-k̭am +ʾayni! Get out my sight!; tlup jahannam vi Go to hell! tləplə xəšlə Good riddance!

(1) to collapse, to fall down (e.g. a wall), to be ruined, to fall apart | beta tləxlə The house collapsed; betu tlixa! May his house collapse. (2) to break, to pull down, to overthrow, to dash down, to demolish | tləxlux beta You destroyed the house; ʾálaha la-táləx bēt-bàbux| May God not destroy your father’s house (oath expressing pleading) (A 42:25); ʾálaha táləx talmìdux| ʾánnə xətnavày| pyášəna màtal| mu-ʾòdi| May God destroy your disciples (oath expressing shock), the sons-in-law are perplexed as to what to do (A 42:21)
(1) to make a disciple of, to convert. (2) to chastise, to torment
to shrink up, to wrinkle (intr. and tr.) | sebuyta k̭am-talməssalə Old age has shrunk him
to become lazy, idle
(Azer. təmiz, Pers. tamīz) to clean, to clean off, to clear away; to become clean, to cleanse oneself, to purify oneself | b-tamməzzívalun cípə They cleaned it (the wheat) of stones (B 10:7)
(1) to sigh, to groan. (2) to grieve, to feel sad
(1) to smoke, to fill with smoke, to blacken with smoke. (2) to kindle a censer, to burn incense, to fumigate. (3) to light (a cigarette)
to shake

def: to drizzle (rain) | +muṱra tantusəla It is drizzling
longdef: (1) to drizzle (rain) | +muṱra tantusəla It is drizzling. (2) to smoulder (slow burning fire), to smoke

def: to become mouldy | xurrac tpənnə The food has become mouldy
longdef: to become mouldy | xurrac tpənnə The food has become mouldy
to sneeze
to spill (intr.), to be scattered, to stream from, to flow | miyya tpəxlun The water spilt. Cf. šapəx I (vn. špaxta) to overflow
(1) to pour, to pour out; to spill | +čay tupəxli I have spilt the tea. (2) to upset, to shed; to empty. (3) to rush upon, to attack
to become fat, to fatten; to smear with fat

(Arab. taraka) (1) to give up, to desert, to leave off (esp. a bad habit) | ʾana +p̂ap̂rus ɟrašta turcali I have given up smoking; c-óya ʾátən tarcátta yá ʾùrxa| you may abandon this path (B 16:8). (2) to disobey a command
to break up (usually bread), to crumble (bread to put in broth etc.) | laxma bətradələ k̭at darə ɟu-yaxni He is breaking up bread to put in the stew
to button; to be buttoned
to button, to clasp
